required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Posterior Capsule Opacification (PCO) Evaluation of the AcrySof SN60AT Lens vs. SN60WF Lens

brief_summary.textblock: To assess posterior capsule opacification (PCO) in patients implanted with either the AcrySof SN60AT lens or the AcrySof SN60WF lens.

primary_outcome.description: Thickening and opacification of the transparent membrane on which the intraocular lens is placed assessed by taking a digital retroillumination image of each eye with a dedicated retroillumination camera system. The photographs were analyzed with POCO software to measure the percentage area of PCO in the capsulorhexis area.

Best spectacle corrected vision was recorded for each eye of the patients at above follow up visits. The Visual Acuity (VA) measurement was taken under high contrast (100%), which means that there was maximum contrast between the letters on the chart and the background. VA is measured in logMAR. LogMAR is the "logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution". A lower logMAR value indicates better visual acuity.

Best spectacle corrected vision was recorded for each eye of the patients at above follow up visits. The Visual Acuity (VA) measurement was taken under low contrast (9%), which means that there was low contrast between the letters on the chart and the background. VA is measured in logMAR. LogMAR is the "logarithm of the minimum angle of resolution". A lower logMAR value indicates better visual acuity.

arm_group.description: Implantation with the AcrySof Intraocular Lens Model SN60AT
Implantation with the AcrySof Intraocular Lens Model SN60WF

intervention.description: Implantation with the AcrySof Intraocular Lens Model SN60AT following cataract removal.
Implantation with the AcrySof Intraocular Lens Model SN60WF following cataract removal.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with bilateral senile cataracts
- Age > 50 years
- Fit for hospital follow ups
- Pupils dilating > 6mm preoperatively
- Eyes expected to see 6/12 or better postoperatively
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes
- On treatment for glaucoma
- Other ocular pathology
- Previous ocular surgery

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations

responsible_party.organization: Associate Director, Surgical IOL, Clinical Science

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Uncomplicated age-related bilateral cataract with the potential to see 20/40 or better in each eye
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: During the preoperative exam, subjects were examined to ensure they met the inclusion/exclusion criteria.

outcome.title: Posterior Capsule Opacification (PCO)
outcome.description: Thickening and opacification of the transparent membrane on which the intraocular lens is placed assessed by taking a digital retroillumination image of each eye with a dedicated retroillumination camera system. The photographs were analyzed with POCO software to measure the percentage area of PCO in the capsulorhexis area.
outcome.population: Data for all patients completing the 24 month visit were analyzed.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publications relating to the study should not be made without the Sponsor’s prior written consent and not prior to the completion of the study. The sponsor shall be notified in writing at least 60 days prior to submission of any intention on the part of the Investigator to publish and shall provide the sponsor an opportunity to comment on any proposed publications.
